meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 1. to get on (train, plane, bus, ship, etc.); to get in; to board; to take; to embark １１時の列車に乗るつもりです。I'm catching the 11:00 train.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 2. to get on (e.g. a footstool); to step on; to jump on; to sit on; to mount See also 載る のるそんなに沢山パンに乗るんか？You really put that much in the sandwich?

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 3. to reach; to go over; to pass 「騙された」と言ってしまえばそれまでですが、「うまい話」に乗った当人であることは間違いありません。If you say "I was tricked," well that's certainly so but there's no mistaking that you were the one who signed up on a "sweet deal".

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 4. to follow; to stay (on track); to go with (the times, etc.)

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 5. to take part; to participate; to join

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 6. to get into the swing (and sing, dance, etc.)

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 7. to be deceived; to be taken in

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 8. to be carried; to be spread; to be scattered usu. with an adverb of manner, e.g. よく乗る

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'ru' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 9. to stick; to attach; to take; to go on usu. with an adverb of manner, e.g. よく乗る
乘る 【のる】、ノる
乘る: Out-dated kanji or kanji usage.

sentence: と言ってしまえばそれまで

meanings.meaning: 1. transfer (trains, buses, etc.); change; connection 途中で乗り換えが必要ですか。Is it necessary to change trains along the way?
2. switch (to another ideology, party, system, method, etc.); change; conversion
3. switching (stock) Finance
4. chromosomal crossover; crossing over Biology, See also 交差
5. Transfer
乗換 【のりかえ】、乗換え 【のりかえ】、乗り替え 【のりかえ】
乗り替え: Rarely-used kanji form.
1. transfer (trains, buses, etc.); change; connection 途中で乗り換えが必要ですか。Is it necessary to change trains along the way?
2. switch (to another ideology, party, system, method, etc.); change; conversion
3. switching (stock) Finance
4. chromosomal crossover; crossing over Biology, See also 交差
5. Transfer
乗換 【のりかえ】、乗換え 【のりかえ】、乗り替え 【のりかえ】
乗り替え: Rarely-used kanji form.

sentences.translation: Is it necessary to change trains along the way?

meanings.meaning: 1. to transfer (trains); to change (bus, train) 東京駅で列車を乗り換えなさい。Change trains at Tokyo Station.

2. to change (to another ideology, party, company, etc.); to switch (to a different system, method, etc.); to move on to (e.g. a new love interest) 彼女がおまえを捨てて英語学校で出逢ったアメリカ人の男性に乗り換えたことを認めてはっきり言ったらどうだい？Why don't you just call a spade a spade and admit that she dumped you for that American guy she met at the English school?
乗りかえる 【のりかえる】、乗換える 【のりかえる】、乗り替える 【のりかえる】、乗替える 【のりかえる】
1. to transfer (trains); to change (bus, train) 東京駅で列車を乗り換えなさい。Change trains at Tokyo Station.

2. to change (to another ideology, party, company, etc.); to switch (to a different system, method, etc.); to move on to (e.g. a new love interest) 彼女がおまえを捨てて英語学校で出逢ったアメリカ人の男性に乗り換えたことを認めてはっきり言ったらどうだい？Why don't you just call a spade a spade and admit that she dumped you for that American guy she met at the English school?
乗りかえる 【のりかえる】、乗換える 【のりかえる】、乗り替える 【のりかえる】、乗替える 【のりかえる】

sentences.translation: Why don't you just call a spade a spade and admit that she dumped you for that American guy she met at the English school?

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'mu' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 1. to board; to embark on; to get into (a car); to man (a ship); to help (someone) into その子は上機嫌で飛行機に乗り込んだ。The child got on an airplane in good mood.

meanings.type: Godan verb with 'mu' ending, Intransitive verb
meanings.meaning: 2. to march into; to enter 一人で原始林へ乗り込もうとは君はなんて勇ましいんだ。How brave of you to go alone into the primaeval forest!
乗りこむ 【のりこむ】、乗込む 【のりこむ】

meanings.meaning: 1. riding; ride 自転車の二人乗りは危険だ。Two people riding on a bicycle at the same time is dangerous.
2. spread (of paints)
3. -seater (e.g. two-seater)

4. (getting into the) mood; (entering into the) spirit; energy; enthusiasm; rhythm; feeling Usually written using kana alone, esp. ノリ. possibly from 気乗りノリもさる事ながら、会場と一体化したような快感が忘れられない。I got really into it, and I just can't forget the exhilaration of becoming one with the audience.
ノリ
